title: Citibank Taiwan Unveils Christmas from Around the World
summary: Taipei - Integrating Citibank's Global Banking offerings with the festivities of Christmas, the 2013 Taipei Christmas City was officially launched in the Xinyi district today by Taipei Mayor Lung-Bin Hau and Citibank Taiwan Chairman Victor Kuan.
tag-1: Citibank Taiwan Unveils Christmas from Around the World
tag-3: Taipei – Integrating Citibank's Global Banking offerings with the festivities of Christmas, the 2013 Taipei Christmas City was officially launched in the Xinyi district today by Taipei Mayor Lung-Bin Hau and Citibank Taiwan Chairman Victor Kuan.
tag-4: This is the fourth year that Citibank Taiwan has sponsored Taipei Christmas City. The unveiling of Taiwan's biggest 3D Christmas card officially marked the start of the event, which will run until December 25.
tag-5: At the opening ceremony, Mayor Lung noted: "Taipei City has been designated as the 2016 World Design Capital (WDC). It is with support from the private sector including companies such as Citibank that we were able to win this honor. This year, Taipei Christmas City integrates dazzling performances and creative designs that help us spark new ideas, while echoing our ambition of becoming the World Design Capital."
tag-6: Speaking at the event, Citibank Taiwan Chairman Victor Kuan said that on the premise of "Citi for Cities," the bank has long applied its global expertise to cater to customers in more than 700 urban cities worldwide.
tag-7: This year, he explains, Citibank has integrated its global financial expertise to customers' daily lives through its Global Banking proposition, ensuring that "A Citi client anywhere is a Citi Client everywhere." With Global Banking, Citibank customers are entitled to real-time financial services and privileges wherever they are.
tag-8: Merging this global banking proposition with this year's Taipei Christmas City, the event features world-renowned landmarks from five cities, including Taipei 101, baby panda Yuan Zai (an honorary citizen of Taipei), the Statue of Liberty in New York, the Eiffel Tower in Paris, the Sydney Opera House and St. Basil's Cathedral in Moscow.
tag-9: Further building on this global theme, five different surprises await the public this Christmas.
tag-10: One side of the Shin Kong Mitsukoshi Chante Square has been decorated as a romantic outdoor café area, mimicking the cozy atmosphere at Paris's picturesque Left Bank, while creative arrangements of many landmarks have been put together to create Taiwan's biggest 3D Christmas card, an impressive scene with Taipei, New York, Paris, Sydney and Moscow in one shot.
tag-11: A series of international Christmas shows will be taking place at the event's main stage featuring New York Jazz, Paris Moulin Rouge, Sydney Opera to the Moscow Circus. On Christmas Eve, Citibank Taiwan will be hosting an evening Christmas party for the public.
tag-12: Also open to public is a treasure hunt segment, where participants can earn a free cup of coffee after collecting five stamps from designated locations on their "passport booklets." Another highlight this year is the "Santa Courier" delivery service; from December 14 to December 22, 500 early birds can place free gift delivery requests for distribution in Taipei.
tag-13: Various Christmas gifts and exclusive offers will also be presented to Citibank customers to share the happiness and celebrate the holiday.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
